title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4066.1 - Unseated rider may remount
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4066.1 - Unseated rider may remount

State Regulations

In steeplechases and hurdle races, any horse losing its
rider may be remounted by such rider in any part of the same field or enclosure
in which the occurrence took place, but should such horse not be caught until
it shall have entered another field, then such horse shall be ridden or brought
back to the one in which it parted from its rider. Any rider so losing his or
her horse may be assisted in catching the horse and remounting it without risk
of disqualification. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4066.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
